title: Library
description: Schema for submitting a molecular library.

notes.title: Notes
notes.comment: A place for the DCC to keep information that does not have a place in the schema.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Documents that provide additional information (not data file).

items.title: Document
items.description: A document that provides additional information (not data file).

lot_id.title: Lot ID
lot_id.description: The lot identifier provided by the vendor, for nucleic acids or proteins purchased directly from a vendor (e.g. total RNA).

product_id.title: Product ID
product_id.description: The product identifier provided by the vendor, for nucleic acids or proteins purchased directly from a vendor (e.g. total RNA).

source.title: Source
source.description: The vendor, for nucleic acids or proteins purchased directly from a vendor (e.g. total RNA).

submitted_by.title: Submitted by
submitted_by.comment: Do not submit. The user that created the object is assigned by the server.

date_created.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is created is assigned by the server.
date_created.title: Date created
date_created.decription: The date the object was created.

lab.title: Lab
lab.comment: Required. See lab.json for list of available identifiers.

award.title: Grant
award.comment: Required. See award.json for list of available identifiers.

aliases.title: Lab aliases
aliases.comment: The purpose of this field is to provide a link into the lab LIMS and to facilitate shared objects.
aliases.description: Lab specific identifiers to reference an object.

items.title: Lab alias
items.comment: Current convention is colon separated lab name and lab identifier. (e.g. john-doe:42).
items.description: A lab specific identifier to reference an object.

alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

items.title: Alternate Accession
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.

alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.

accession.comment: Do not submit. The accession is assigned by the server.
accession.description: A unique identifier to be used to reference the object prefixed with ENC.
accession.title: Accession

uuid.comment: Do not submit. The uuid is set by the server.
uuid.description: The unique identifier associated with every object.
uuid.title: UUID

schema_version.title: Schema Version
schema_version.comment: Do not submit. The version used to validate the object is set by the server. The default should be set to the current version.
schema_version.description: The version of the JSON schema that the server uses to validate the object.

spikeins_used.title: Spike-ins datasets used
spikeins_used.description: The datasets containing the fasta and the concentrations of the library spike-ins.

biosample.title: Biosample
biosample.description: The biosample that nucleic acid was isolated from to generate the library.

nucleic_acid_term_name.title: Molecule term
nucleic_acid_term_name.description: SO (Sequence Ontology) term best matching the molecule isolated to generate the library (e.g. 'RNA' for a total RNA library, even if that library is subsequently reverse transcribed for DNA sequencing.)

items.title: External identifier
items.description: A unique identifier from external resource.

nucleic_acid_starting_quantity.title: Nucleic acid starting quantity
nucleic_acid_starting_quantity.description: The starting amount of nucleic acid before selection and purification.

nucleic_acid_starting_quantity_units.title: Nucleic acid starting quantity units
nucleic_acid_starting_quantity_units.description: The units used for starting amount of nucleic acid.

extraction_method.title: Extraction method
extraction_method.description: A short description or reference of the nucleic acid extraction protocol used in library preparation, if applicable.

fragmentation_method.title: Fragmentation method
fragmentation_method.description: A short description or reference of the nucleic acid fragmentation protocol used in library preparation, if applicable.

fragmentation_date.title: Fragmentation date
fragmentation_date.comment: Date can be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSTZD (TZD is the time zone designator; use Z to express time in UTC or for time expressed in local time add a time zone offset from UTC +HH:MM or -HH:MM).
fragmentation_date.description: The date that the nucleic acid was fragmented.

library_size_selection_method.title: Size selection method
library_size_selection_method.description: A short description or reference of the size selection protocol used in library preparation, if applicable.

lysis_method.title: Lysis method
lysis_method.description: A short description or reference of the cell lysis protocol used in library preparation, if applicable

crosslinking_method.title: Crosslinking method
crosslinking_method.description: A short description or reference of the crosslinking protocol used in library preparation, if applicable.

size_range.title: Size range
size_range.description: The measured size range of the purified nucleic acid, in bp.

strand_specificity.title: Strand specific
strand_specificity.description: The preparation of the library uses a strand-specific protocol.

depleted_in_term_name.title: Depleted in term
depleted_in_term_name.description: SO (Sequence Ontology) term best matching the nucleic acid that was diminished from the library.
